meanings.definition: Animals that maintain a relatively constant body temperature.
meanings.sent1: Homeotherms like humans and birds can regulate their body temperature.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study homeotherms to understand how they keep their body temperature stable.
meanings.sent3: The homeotherms at the zoo always seem comfortable in any weather.
meanings.sent4: In a world of changing temperatures, homeotherms stand out like beacons of stability.
meanings.sent5: The concept of homeotherms is like having a built-in thermostat for animals.

meanings.definition: Organisms that regulate their body temperature internally.
meanings.sent1: Homeotherms, such as mammals, can control their body temperature regardless of the external environment.
meanings.sent2: It is fascinating to learn how homeotherms maintain their internal temperature within a narrow range.
meanings.sent3: The homeotherms in the forest have a secret to staying warm in winter.
meanings.sent4: The ability of homeotherms to self-regulate temperature is like having a personal heater inside.
meanings.sent5: The survival of homeotherms depends on their mastery of internal temperature control.

meanings.definition: Creatures that are able to keep a stable internal temperature.
meanings.sent1: Homeotherms, like polar bears, can adapt to extreme cold by regulating their internal temperature.
meanings.sent2: Zoos provide a controlled environment for homeotherms to maintain their stable internal temperature.
meanings.sent3: The homeotherms in the desert have a cool trick to beat the heat.
meanings.sent4: The resilience of homeotherms in maintaining stable internal temperature is truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The concept of homeotherms is like having a built-in climate control system for animals.
